home.title: Decentralized Digital Family Tree
home.subtitle: Zero-knowledge privacy ¬∑ Unlinkability ¬∑ Multi-version governance ¬∑ Community endorsement ¬∑ NFT biographies

coreValue.title: Core Mission
coreValue.description: Building a permanently trusted global digital genealogy infrastructure

valueProps.title: Core Value Propositions
valueProps.subtitle: A trusted multi-dimensional genealogy layer turning open exploration into confirmed value.

zkPrivacy.title: Zero-Knowledge Privacy
zkPrivacy.description: Zero-knowledge proofs privately submit family relationships, proving the committer holds the private data behind the commitment without revealing plaintext

saltedUnlinkability.title: Unlinkability
saltedUnlinkability.description: Optional passphrases are Poseidon-salted to block identity inference and pollution; share a passphrase for collaboration or keep one private to isolate

dualTreeModels.title: Multi-Version Governance
dualTreeModels.description: People can submit multiple versions in parallel; on-chain deduplication plus parent pointers preserve traceable history while endorsements surface the most trusted one

communityEndorsement.title: Community Endorsement
communityEndorsement.description: Endorsing with DEEP utility points carries real cost, so endorsers vote with fees to surface trustworthy versions and dilute noise

nftValueCreation.title: NFT Value Creation
nftValueCreation.description: Backed versions mint into NFT biographies where holders route future endorsement fees and story traffic, recognizing quality contributions

storyShardingSealing.title: Story Sharding & Sealing
storyShardingSealing.description: Story shards append details with hash checks; sealing makes them permanently immutable so archives stay rich and trustworthy

valueSystem.title: Two-Layer Value System
valueSystem.subtitle: Progressive privacy path: hash submission ‚Üí community endorsement ‚Üí NFT disclosure

layer1.title: Hash Privacy Layer
layer1.description: Only salted hash commitments are submitted at this layer‚Äîno plaintext ever touches the chain. Zero-knowledge proofs keep the entire submission process private.
layer1.feature1: Store salted hash commitments only, no plaintext on-chain
layer1.feature2: Salted passphrases block identity inference and pollution
layer1.feature3: Shared passphrases enable private collaboration; strong solo passphrases fully isolate trees

layer2.title: NFT Biography Layer
layer2.description: Endorsed versions can be minted into NFT biographies, and minting immediately discloses the full narrative on-chain. Story sharding keeps detailed histories verifiable over time.
layer2.feature1: Minting publishes the complete NFT biography
layer2.feature2: Endorsements drive community consensus and incentives
layer2.feature3: Story shards extend biographies with on-chain verification

flow.title: Privacy to Value Flow
flow.description: From private hash storage to community-validated NFT assets
flow.step1Desc: Add family members with zero-knowledge proofs
flow.step2Desc: Mint NFTs revealing full biographical information

dualModels.title: Dual Family Tree Models
dualModels.description: Salted passphrase system enables both collaborative public trees and pollution-resistant private trees

public.title: Public Collaborative Trees
public.description: Shared passphrases enable multiple users to collaboratively build comprehensive family trees together.

private.title: Private Protected Trees
private.description: Unique passphrases create completely protected trees immune to pollution attacks and relationship corruption.

advantages.title: Workflow
advantages.subtitle: Five-step value discovery and consensus formation mechanism
advantages.step1Desc: Submit parent hash commitments ‚Üí receive DEEP utility distribution
advantages.step2Desc: Pay DEEP utility points to endorse a version
advantages.step3Desc: Endorsers can mint NFTs for corresponding versions
advantages.step4Desc: NFT holders write/append person story fragments
advantages.step5Desc: Seal stories to form immutable on-chain historical records
advantages.conclusionDesc: Through utility-gated actions and contribution-based distributions, enabling organic accumulation and discovery of high-quality genealogy data

privacyLayer.title: Privacy Protection Layer
privacyLayer.description: Privacy protection mechanism based on zero-knowledge proofs, ensuring security of sensitive information

valueLayer.title: Value Confirmation Layer
valueLayer.description: Confirming data quality and routing functional fees through utility-based consensus mechanisms

features.title: Core Features
features.subtitle: An end-to-end workflow turning private submissions into lasting genealogy value

zkVersion.title: Private Submission Flow
zkVersion.description: Zero-knowledge proofs with salted passphrase commitments keep onboarding private while only hash commitments touch the chain.

versionManagement.title: Multi-Version Governance
versionManagement.description: Person versions store parent pointers and timestamps; on-chain deduplication plus endorsement ordering keeps history traceable.

endorsementEconomy.title: Endorsement Utility Loop
endorsementEconomy.description: Every endorsement costs DEEP and splits between holder, contributor, and protocol‚Äîfunctional fee routing that ties trust to on-chain actions.

personNFT.title: NFT Biographies
personNFT.description: Endorsed versions mint into NFT biographies that disclose core info; holders can extend stories and capture ongoing fee streams.

storySharding.title: Story Sharding & Sealing
storySharding.description: Append life stories in 100√ó1KB shards with hash checks, then seal them for immutable, trustworthy on-chain archives.

versionNotarization.title: Collaboration & Private Modes
versionNotarization.description: Default no-passphrase joins the public space; shared passphrases enable joint trees, while strong solo passphrases create isolated private zones.

tokenomics.title: Utility & Incentives
tokenomics.subtitle: DEEP utility points gate actions and allocate to complete, verified data‚Äîno investment promises

deepToken.title: DEEP Utility Points
deepToken.description: Progressive halving utility issuance used solely for protocol actions; rewards follow contributions while maintaining supply discipline.

supply.title: Supply Cap
supply.description: Utility supply capped at 100B with no pre-mine or fundraising; minting only via protocol interactions.

mining.title: Issuance Trigger
mining.description: Utility rewards mint only when parent hash commitments are submitted, incentivizing structured completion without exposing plaintext.

endorsement.title: Endorsement Fees
endorsement.description: Fees mirror the current utility issuance level; the protocol can retain a small share to curb self-endorsement and fund operations.

distribution.title: Fee Distribution
distribution.description: Fees route between submitters and NFT holders based on stage; they are functional transfers, not investment returns.

goal.title: Protocol Goals
goal.description: Align real costs with data quality to reward accurate relationships while suppressing spam and noise.

audience.title: Target Audiences
audience.subtitle: A collaborative ecosystem where every role contributes and benefits

contributors.title: Data Contributors
contributors.description: Input, enrich, and verify genealogy data to build a trusted network

researchers.title: Family Researchers
researchers.description: Track version evolution and divergences to surface multi-voiced family narratives
researchers.benefit2: Explore hidden links across relationship graphs

developers.title: Developers
developers.description: Integrate contracts and components to build secondary apps and knowledge tooling

creators.title: Narrative Creators
creators.description: Write and seal family stories, turning memories into verifiable archives

contracts.title: Smart Contract Architecture
contracts.subtitle: A complete family tree smart contract system covering person management, endorsement systems, NFT minting, and governance mechanisms

cta.title: Start Building Your Digital Family Tree
cta.subtitle: Build your digital family tree using smart contracts and search in constructing a decentralized family history recording system

hashCalculator.title: Calculate personHash Locally
hashCalculator.tip: üí° Tip: Use the tool below to calculate person hash, then copy it to use in the queries below
hashCalculator.name: Full Name
hashCalculator.passphrasePlaceholder: Enter any characters‚Äîfamily mottos or secret phrases. 15+ characters with mixed symbols recommended

passphraseHelp.title: Passphrase Usage Guide
passphraseHelp.privacyDesc: Adds an extra protection layer to your identity hash, preventing others from guessing your identity through name and birth date.
passphraseHelp.optionalDesc: Optional; accepts any characters such as mottos or secret codes. Relatives can share one passphrase to collaborate‚Äîuse 15+ characters and keep it safe for better privacy.
passphraseHelp.rememberDesc: Passphrase cannot be recovered. If forgotten, a different identity hash will be generated.
passphraseHelp.privacyNote: The passphrase is hashed locally only; nothing is uploaded or stored.

passwordTips.weak: üí° Tip: Use at least 15+ mixed characters or 20+ letters for better security

hashCalculator.entropyDisplay: Raw entropy: {{raw}} bits ¬∑ Adjusted strength score: {{adjusted}}
hashCalculator.description: Note: Calculation logic is completely consistent with the contract getPersonHash.

storyChunkEditor.title: Profile Data Editor
storyChunkEditor.noChunksSealed: This profile is sealed with no chunks.

sealDialog.title: Seal Biography
sealDialog.description: Are you sure you want to seal the biography? Once sealed, it can no longer be modified.

chunkTypeHelp.title: Story Chunk Types Guide
chunkTypeHelp.intro: Story chunks are content type tags for organizing biographical narratives and life stories. These 19 types allow flexible storytelling - you can use multiple chunks of the same type in any order.
chunkTypeHelp.summaryDesc: Brief overview of the person's life and significance
chunkTypeHelp.lifeEventsDesc: Chronological life story from birth to present/death. Can include career, family, society - a complete timeline.
chunkTypeHelp.specializedDesc: Thematic deep dives extracted from life narrative
chunkTypeHelp.activitiesDesc: Public service, charity, speeches, social causes
chunkTypeHelp.note1: These are content type tags, not exclusive chapters - you can have multiple chunks of the same type
chunkTypeHelp.note2: Types are not mutually exclusive - feel free to use types in any order
chunkTypeHelp.note3: Life Events: For chronological narrative (birth ‚Üí childhood ‚Üí adulthood ‚Üí death)
chunkTypeHelp.note4: Career: For focused professional history (jobs, companies, positions)
chunkTypeHelp.note5: Early Life vs Life Events: Early Life for childhood snippets, Life Events for full timeline

storyChunkEditor.contentPlaceholderBytes: Enter chunk content (max 2048 bytes ‚âà 2048 ASCII or ~680 CJK chars)
storyChunkEditor.offlineNoData: Offline mode: story not cached locally

actions.title: Blockchain Actions
actions.subtitle: Interact with the DeepFamily protocol using your connected wallet
actions.walletRequiredDesc: Connect your wallet to access blockchain features like adding versions, endorsing data, and minting NFTs.
actions.whatYouCanDo: What you can do after connecting:
actions.feature1: Add new person versions (receive DEEP utility points)
actions.feature2: Endorse quality data and route utility fees
actions.feature3: Mint person versions as NFT collectibles
actions.addVersionDesc: Add a new version of person data with zero-knowledge proofs
actions.mintNFTDesc: Convert endorsed person data into valuable NFT collectibles
actions.endorseDesc: Support quality data by endorsing versions with DEEP utility points
actions.mintNFTHint: First search for a person and version to mint as NFT
actions.endorseHint: Search for person versions to endorse

addVersion.metadataCIDPlaceholder: Will be auto-generated from metadata on submission
addVersion.successDesc: The person version has been added to the blockchain
addVersion.zkProofVerifiedDesc: Zero-knowledge proof was successfully verified on-chain
addVersion.versionAddedDesc: Person version was successfully added to the family tree
addVersion.familyComplete: Parent hash commitments submitted - utility points distributed
addVersion.tokenRewardCondition: Utility points distribute when parent hash commitments are submitted
addVersion.tokenRewardTip: Submit parent hash commitments to receive DEEP utility distributions
addVersion.ageRequirement: The person being added must be 18 years or older. Do not submit minors' identities.
addVersion.consentHash: I understand plaintext stays off-chain, but its hash will be permanently public on-chain and cannot be removed.
addVersion.consentAge: I confirm the person is 18 years or older.
addVersion.consentLegal: I confirm the data is lawful, truthful, and authorized for disclosure; no extra private content is included.

addVersion.proofGenerationNote: ZK proof generation requires complex cryptographic calculations. Please wait...
addVersion.personInfoHint: Plain text stays off-chain; used only for local ZK proof
addVersion.personInfoPrivacy: Person information is only used locally to generate zero-knowledge proofs. Plain text will not be stored on-chain, only the hash value is permanently recorded.
addVersion.parentInfoNotice: Providing parent info locally generates zero-knowledge proofs for family linking (only hash values go on-chain) and triggers DEEP utility distribution. Parent info must match their actual versions exactly (incl. passphrase) to establish connection.

mintNFT.title: Mint NFT
mintNFT.description: Create a unique NFT for this person
mintNFT.headerOnChainHint: Minting is public: plain text is permanently on-chain and undeletable
mintNFT.specifyVersionDesc: Enter the person hash and version index of the version you want to mint as NFT.
mintNFT.targetRequired: Please provide a valid person hash and version index.
mintNFT.invalidPersonHashFormat: Person hash must be 0x-prefixed 32-byte hex (64 hex chars).
mintNFT.basicInfoMustMatch: The basic information you enter must exactly match the target version data. The contract will verify this on-chain before minting.
mintNFT.legalTruthfulNotice: Submit only lawful, truthful information you are authorized to disclose publicly; do not include private data outside the intended public scope.
mintNFT.ageRequirement: The person minted into an NFT must be 18 years or older. Do not submit minors' identities.
mintNFT.consentPublic: I understand this mint makes the entered info permanently public on-chain and undeletable.
mintNFT.consentAge: I confirm the person is 18 years or older.
mintNFT.consentLegal: I confirm the data is lawful, truthful, and authorized for public disclosure without extra private content.
mintNFT.consentMissing: Please confirm all required checkboxes before minting.
mintNFT.supplementalInfoImmutable: Supplemental information will be permanently stored on the blockchain and cannot be modified after submission. Please fill in carefully.
mintNFT.tokenURIHint: Optional: URL or IPFS hash for NFT metadata
mintNFT.nftAlreadyMintedDesc: This version has already been minted as an NFT. Each version can only be minted once.
mintNFT.endorsementRequiredDesc: You must endorse this version before minting. Would you like to go endorse now?
mintNFT.successDesc: Your NFT has been created on the blockchain
mintNFT.mintingDesc: Creating your unique NFT on the blockchain...
mintNFT.proofGenerationNote: ZK proof generation requires heavy cryptography. Please keep this tab active until completion.
mintNFT.nftMintedEventDesc: NFT was successfully minted and recorded on-chain

errors.versionAlreadyMinted: This version has already been minted as NFT
errors.mustEndorseFirst: You must endorse this version before minting
errors.basicInfoMismatch: Person information does not match the version data

mintNFT.missingBothParents: Both parent hashes are empty for this version. Publish a new ZK version with parent hashes (version index can be 0 to defer choosing a parent version).
mintNFT.missingFather: The father hash is empty for this version. Publish a new ZK version with the father hash; index 0 lets the UI pick the highest-endorsed father version.
mintNFT.missingMother: The mother hash is empty for this version. Publish a new ZK version with the mother hash; index 0 lets the UI pick the highest-endorsed mother version.

keyDerivation.title: üîê Secure Key Derivation
keyDerivation.subtitle: Derive Ethereum private keys from personal information and a strong passphrase using KDF algorithm. Deterministic recovery without storing private keys.
keyDerivation.description: PersonHash(name, birthday, gender, passphrase) ‚Üí scrypt KDF (N=131072) ‚Üí Private Key ‚Üí Ethereum Address
keyDerivation.note: Same input always generates same key | KDF provides 131,072√ó brute-force protection

component.title: Secure Key Derivation
component.description: Derive secure Ethereum private keys from personal information and a strong passphrase using KDF algorithm.
component.passphraseWarning: ‚ö†Ô∏è Must use a strong passphrase with 15+ characters!
component.fillInfoFirst: Please fill in personal information first
component.kdfStrength: KDF Strength (affects security and computation time)
component.tip1: Private key controls assets, never reveal to anyone
component.tip2: Remember your name, birthday and passphrase to recover anytime
component.tip3: Any tiny change in information will produce a different private key
component.tip4: Recommended to backup passphrase to a secure location
component.weakPassphraseContinue: Do you still want to continue? (Not recommended)

recommendations.empty: ‚ö†Ô∏è Empty passphrase: insufficient security. Strongly recommend a 15+ character strong passphrase
recommendations.weak: ‚ùå Raw entropy: ~{{raw}} bits ¬∑ Adjusted strength score: ~{{adjusted}}. Insufficient security. Recommend: 15+ mixed characters or 20+ letters
recommendations.medium: ‚ö†Ô∏è Raw entropy: ~{{raw}} bits ¬∑ Adjusted strength score: ~{{adjusted}}. Below recommended threshold. Recommend: 18+ characters with symbols/emoji
recommendations.strong: ‚úÖ Raw entropy: ~{{raw}} bits ¬∑ Adjusted strength score: ~{{adjusted}}. Good security
recommendations.veryStrong: üîê Raw entropy: ~{{raw}} bits ¬∑ Adjusted strength score: ~{{adjusted}}. Strong security
recommendations.excellent: üõ°Ô∏è Raw entropy: ~{{raw}} bits ¬∑ Adjusted strength score: ~{{adjusted}}. Excellent security
